oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: When You're Tired Of Breaking Other Hearts - Curley Williams performance - 1952-09-15
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Performance of When You're Tired Of Breaking Other Hearts, written by Hank Williams and Curley Williams, published by Sony/ATV Acuff Rose Music, produced by Don Law, recorded on September 15, 1952 at the Castle Studio in the Tulane Hotel in Nashville, TN, and performed by Curley Williams (vocal and fiddle), Jack Pruett (guitar), Joe Gibson (guitar), Clyde Boots Harris (steel), Billy Diehl (bass), and Papa John Gordy (piano).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Curley Williams
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (0:00) Curley Williams performs "When You're Tired Of Breaking Other Hearts"
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Williams, Hank, 1923-1953; Williams, Curley, 1913-1970; Law, Donald F., 1902-1982; Pruett, Jack; Gordy, John (Pianist)
